messages.message: my sandbox seems to be crash looping after I rebuilt and tried to pull images again: https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/charles-goldens?cw=dev (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/charles-goldens?cw=dev) been like this for a day, anyone able to help? I have local git changes on here I need to push..
Looks like the box is out of storage, let me contact the crafting devs to give you more space
Your sandbox has its storage increased @Charles
but it seems like it’s nearly filled out actually. Lemme ssh into it and start clearing out docker images before it bricks again
thanks paul! i saw but didnt know where to go from there

npnp. I also noticed that you’re getting these errors in your sandbox which is preventing your services from spinning up:
```ImportError: cannot import name 'intercept_channel_tracing' from 'instabase.tracing.grpc' (/instabase-api-server/py/instabase/tracing/grpc/__init__.py)```
Try running the following commands to fix it:
```cs stop # stops all services

cd $IB_HOME/webserver/api-server && make clean
cd $IB_HOME/distributed-tasks/celery/app-tasks && make clean
cd $IB_HOME/webserver/data-services/model-services/model-service && make clean

cs start # starts all services again```
and if you see that error in any other services, just go into the dir and run `make clean` like above.
yep ill try these, thanks for helping me out!

^ that should be a one time thing bc of some code changes. But I see this issue as well that’s preventing some containers from spinning up:
```ERROR: failed to solve: 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17): failed to resolve source metadata for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/python:3.9.17): unexpected status from HEAD request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-build/python/manifests/3.9.17: 403 Forbidden```
You’ll need to run these manually (for some reason) every week or so:
```/home/owner/instabase/.sandbox/ibdev-backend/scripts/ecr-login
/home/owner/instabase/.sandbox/ibdev-backend/scripts/gcr-login```
then the containers should work. Oh the joys of hidden knowledge
They're supposed to run automatically^ but who knows
Would be better to have a permanent ECR API key, but I was told by Cody and security that this is not allowed. Maybe I can push on that harder...?
@mfichman I looked at the logs and the ecr logins were failing bc the box had no disk space left. So luckily we don’t have to push on a permanent API key just yet
And the box ran out of disk space because the `docker system prune` command was hanging. I actually have a fix for it, but I’m waiting on another bricked sandbox to test it before putting up a PR.
